definition: Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
summer
the Xia or Hsia dynasty c. 2000 BC/Xia of the Sixteen Kingdoms (407-432)/surname Xia
Xixia district of Yinchuan city 銀川市|银川市[Yin2 chuan1 shi4], Ningxia

sentences.english: Xixia Tongguanshan India unearthed in 1983 for the objects.
sentences.chinese: 西夏铜官印1983年出土，为一级文物。

sentences.english: This site is located slightly north from the centre of the Hetao plain on the northern edge of the Xixia (Tangut) domain.
sentences.chinese: 该遗址位于河套平原中部偏北，地处西夏国的北部。

sentences.english: Living in the countryside was only Patricia's passing fancy.
sentences.chinese: 到乡村定居不过是帕里西夏一时兴起的想法。

sentences.english: After eating breakfast, you will visit the Western Xia Tombs on the way back to Yinchuan.
sentences.chinese: 早餐后，回银川路上，参观西夏陵墓。

sentences.english: To wipe out Xixia , the Song government engaged in Xihelu carefully.
sentences.chinese: 宋政府悉心经营熙河路，目的是为灭亡西夏打基础。

sentences.english: The unique characteristics of Western Xia mausoleums are clearly visible on the spiritual terraces.
sentences.chinese: 西夏陵墓的唯一特征是可以明显地看出其等级。

sentences.english: In the end, we investigated the historical role of the Xixia grottoes arts.
sentences.chinese: 第五，就西夏石窟艺术的历史地位做了探讨。

sentences.english: Thirdly, Xixia copper in order to increase control iron district money.
sentences.chinese: 其三，西夏为了加大对铜的控制，特设铁钱区。

sentences.english: Shen Zong Emperor began to assume a strategic offensive to the West Xia after his enthronement.
sentences.chinese: 宋神宗即位后，开始在战略上对西夏采取攻势。

sentences.english: The cultural structure has also been transplanted into the Xixia culture.
sentences.chinese: 儒学的文化结构，也大都被移植到西夏文化之中。

sentences.english: The quick development of Tangut exerts a very significant impact on the iuland trade and commerce in the northwest.
sentences.chinese: 西夏的崛起对于西北陆路贸易有着强烈的影响。

sentences.english: This as a background, the legal ideology of the West Xia Dynasty became stablished gradually and came to consolidated finally.
sentences.chinese: 在此背景下，西夏的法律思想也趋于成熟并巩固下来。

sentences.english: Tangut version of the Sutra was translated from Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 西夏文佛经是从汉语翻译来的。

sentences.english: Some calendars in Xixia state were from Song Dynasty, some had historical relationships with that in Central Plains.
sentences.chinese: 西夏历法承袭中原历法，与宋朝历法有渊源关系。

sentences.english: Cultivation was one of the important means in the replenishment of Song's army during the wartime with Xixia.
sentences.chinese: 屯田是宋军在对西夏作战中粮食补给的重要来源之一。

sentences.english: Xixia flat kettle had been formed through thousands years of history.
sentences.chinese: 西夏扁壶是在千百年的历史演变中形成的。

definition: Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Li Yuanhao (1003-1048), founding king of Xixia 西夏[Xi1 Xia4] around modern Ningxia 寧夏|宁夏[Ning2 xia4]
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Jin Dynasty (1115-1234), founded by the Jurchen 女真[Nu:3 zhen1] people of North China, a precursor of the Mongol Yuan Dynasty
Western Liao, Khitan kingdom of central Asia 1132-1218
Turkic ethnic group
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Han of the Five dynasties (951-979), one of ten kingdoms during the Five Dynasties, Ten Kingdoms period (907-960)
Mongolia
Song Dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
Yollig Taxin or Yelü Dashi (1087-1143), Chinese-educated Khitan leader, founder of Western Liao 西遼|西辽 in Central Asia
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
old place name (up to Tang), in Hengshan county 橫山縣|横山县, Yulin, Shaanxi
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture
